answer: The current study extends our understanding of the relationship between mass-loss rates and crystalline silicate features in AGB stars by showing that low mass-loss rate AGB stars might also form crystalline silicates, as suggested by radiative transfer calculations (astro-ph/0101256).
explanation: This paper best supports the answer because it presents a study on the relationship between mass-loss rates and crystalline silicate features in AGB stars, and provides an alternative explanation to the lack of crystalline silicate features in low mass-loss rate AGB stars.
evidence_quote: crystalline silicate features in their spectra
